name: Tres Leches Bread Pudding
author: Yoly
summary: Got stale bread? Don't toss it! Make tres leches bread pudding. Made with three different types of milk this recipe is perfect for day-old, dried up, stale bread. I used Oroweat® 12-grain bread which added a nuttier taste but white bread will also work. This is also egg-less!
ingredients: 4 cups day-old 12-grain bread (such as Oroweat®), cut into 1-inch cubes
directions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Mix sweetened condensed milk, evaporated milk, milk, vanilla extract, and cinnamon together in a large bowl
Add bread cubes and stir until well incorporated
Let sit for 5 minutes so bread will absorb some of the liquid
Add walnuts and raisins and stir to combine
Pour mixture into the prepared baking dish
Dot with Neufchatel cheese, pressing down
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes
